intro: Camissonia angelorum, commonly known as the angel's flower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
